review_text: Great place to stay for visiting Death Valley. Convenient location in Pahrump (10 min from wal mart, restaurants, etc), quiet private location. Instructions clear and very very responsive. The only thing I would say is that the shower head kind of shoots water in every direction, and is definitely a bit intense when you initially turn it on haha. However, it is an easy fix and we were only there for a night so it wasn’t a big deal. Would definitely stay here again if I come back. Would recommend!
Cute little place in the north part of town. Quiet, peaceful and it was a great stay.
A very convenient place to stay if you’re travelling to DV. Everything was as was detailed in the pictures and description. The bed in the loft was comfy! Would definitely recommend.
What we needed after Death Valley
Great place to stay that’s easily accessible to Death Valley NP. I was able to keep my dogs cool inside while at the park for the day. Super neat little casita set up.
Well located if going to Death Valley and Michael was very responsive

My brother and I were traveling to see Death Valley National Park and Michael's spot was the perfect spot to stay for visiting. The area was clean and had everything we needed. The location was perfect for getting to the park as well as getting everything we needed down the road. If you're wanting to see Death Valley, Michael's place is the perfect spot!
We felt very comfortable at Michael's place and it was all clean. The kitchen is very well equipped with everything you need for cooking!
Great communication! Place was exactly as described and the location was great.

Lovely airbnb!
It was so cozy and perfect stay for someone wanting to go to Death valley. hosts were friendly, communicative and accommodating. We had a great time staying here!
We enjoyed to stay at the cozy loft and the location was perfect to visite death valley.
Location is really beautiful, we had great stay here.

Nice place to stay! I would say as a dog person that the 3 large dogs were harder to control when entering the gate of the property. There is a small furnace that doesn’t produce much heat which made the loft area pretty cold. The oven didn’t work when I was there which made last minute dinner changes. That said, it was very close to the national park and a secure place.
Great place to stay not too far outside of Death Valley. Town had cheap gas and the casita was peaceful and quiet.

Clean/cozy tiny home… feels safe being on the owner’s property as well. I arrived late and had no issues getting in (instructions were clear). Fantastic value and better/cheaper than most hotel rooms. All around solid and glad I stayed here for a night’s rest before heading out to Death Valley National Park.
This Casita was so cute and exactly as described. Very comfortable bed.

Great little place cozy for 2, with our 2 pups. Everything was well thought out. Anything you need to cook to save on eating out. The bathroom was perfect with plenty of linens. Really a great spot if you’re looking to head into Death Valley National Park!
Perfect place to stay while exploring death valley. the fridge came in clutch to stock some foods to eat when we got back from hiking
This was a great location for us and we enjoyed our stay!

Michael's place was perfect for my group of 4. Well located between Vegas and Death Valley, and within close proximity to the town center. The place was exactly as described. Michael and his team was also very responsive and helpful in answering any queries. We dropped something at their place, but his team was very accommodating in arranging for us to collect our item the next day. Highly recommend his place!
Had everything we needed
Quiet place

This spot was perfect. Being able to get to it from death valley no problem and also michaels helpful suggestions of where to eat was spot on. Arriving at the cabin was easy and instructions clear. It was cozy, warm and if you want to rest up after a long day of driving and hiking this spot is great. Check out was very simple and would stay here again.
Clear and easy instructions to follow. Thank you!

Michael’s place is very convenient if you’re visiting Death Valley. There aren’t so many places to stay there, so we were happy to find his loft that was well equipped for what we needed for our 1 night stay.

This place was a great stop just outside Death Valley National Park. For a smaller space, it comfortably fit 4 adults (2 couples) and a small dog. Had all the amenities we needed for a quick stay, would recommend for anyone coming through the area on a road trip or other quick trip!
This place was perfect for my quick trip to Death Valley National Park!

We stayed here during our trip to Death Valley. The location is fantastic for proximity to the park and it was easy to find, however it's a rural area and the neighbors have a rooster that will wake you up around 4am.
If you are planning on using the kitchen please know that it lacks basic necessities that most Airbnbs provide such as a spatula, non-stick cooking spray, aluminum foil, or spices beyond salt and pepper.
During our stay the oven/stove broke, but the host was nice enough to allow us to use the oven in the main house and brought us a hot plate which worked out fine. Some of our vegetables froze solid while in the refrigerator so that was a bummer for dinner. Washing our dishes in the kitchen sink was tricky as the water sometimes took over 5 minutes to get hot.
It's great if you just need a place to crash and don't plan on using the kitchen much. We would stay here again but would go out to eat for every meal.
Place was nice and well maintained. The amenities were abundant to the price paid.

This is my first time staying at this location. It is so cute and very comfy. This was a last-minute booking the host's communication was excellent.
Will stay again.
Highly recommend staying here! Very affordable, close to restaurants and an easy hour drive into Death Valley park! Had everything we needed and the bed was very comfortable!

This is a great place to stay for a trip to Death Valley! The reason for 4 stars is because the oven was not functional, which was found out after having already purchased food that required an oven. Michael did offer the alternative of using an oven in a different occupied property on-site, but this felt uncomfortable. I feel this should've been mentioned beforehand. Other than this, the space was clean and the bed was comfortable. Michael was responsive and friendly too.

Micheal has 3 Airbnb’s on his property. The cozy loft and 2 RV trailers. We rented the cozy loft however upon arrival another couple had occupied it. Michael addressed the situation by asking the couple to move to the RV that they had rented. They refused to move. Michael gave us the choice of taking the RV at a discount or getting a full refund . We decided to stay in the RV. The RV was very clean and had everything we needed. It was warm and comfy. Our only concern was that the 2 big dogs on the property charged us twice barking. In the dark it was scary but once we saw them in the daylight they seemed friendly enough.
Overall we had a good stay even though we were disappointed we didn’t get the loft we rented and that human beings can be so rude as to occupy a place they didn’t rent and refuse to move. Hopefully a lesson was learned and this won’t happen to another guest. Michael did the best he could considering the circumstances.
Great views, clean house, but it can get really cold in winters because the AC was comparatively small for the entire house.
Great host! Clear instructions and nice house!
This place was perfect for us visiting Death Valley!

My wife and I stayed here with our 15 month old after visiting Death Valley National Park. This was a perfect place for us since it was close to town and not too far from the park. The house was very clean and well equipped. The hot water was a little tricky to figure out, but we got it working with no issues. Great place to stay and the dogs are very friendly!

My son and I and our two dogs stayed at the Casita which fit the bill perfectly for our trip. His instructions were clear and easy to follow. The casita was clean, quiet, well stocked kitchen and very comfortable. Michael was responsive and very accommodating about our dogs and his dogs. Thanks!
Great place to stay and great hosts highly recommend

Reservation was for my wife & I. Our son & his wife dropped us off because we didn’t have our own car. They had their own accommodations across town. Michael wrongly assumed 4 of us were staying and attempted to charge for 4 people without first asking. We feel he could have handled this better instead of him jumping to the wrong conclusion right away. Our 1st experience/interaction with an Airbnb could have been better.

Michael's place was as depicted. Check-in was easy. The hot tub was a great amenity. Only thing to note was that the shower water temperature was VERY temperamental. I'm sure it has to do with heating up water that's very cold. Not a major issue, just an fyi.

Michael was always responsive, and immediately dealt with issues that came up. I appreciate being moved to a different space in order for me to enjoy my stay while repairs were needed.
The space is private, well kept, and was the perfect sanctuary for my stay. Thanks again.

My fiancé and I stayed here to explore Death Valley. It was a very easy drive to/from and has beautiful views. The hosts are very friendly and we enjoyed spending some time with them and their 3 dogs. They gave us great recommendations via text and in a binder. We used the fire pit which was great and enjoyed the campfire under the stars nightly. There are many places to get firewood around.
My fiancé is terrified of heights but was able to go up the ladder to the loft with some encouragement. There is a futon that converts to a full sized bed as an alternative.
The TV has any network you want to connect to (Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime,etc) your personal account. He also supplied us with waters, coffee and other essentials.
The gas station, restaurant and family dollar are nearby but does not negatively affect the views, stay, safety or comfort level. Overall we had a wonderful time and absolutely recommend staying here.

Place was very beautiful cozy and cute! Love a tiny home so that was great! Only thing that was difficult is trying to see where it was there’s no clear instruction on how to get to the tiny house nor photos of what the outside looked like had to go based off what door looked like and find it myself but other then that we loved our stay!
Great place to stay. Has everything you need.

Very nice stay at Michael’s. We had a little problem with the hot water and he managed to handle it directly and repair the breakdown.
The place is nice, next time we will definitely try the hot tub :-)

We stayed at Michael's place for one night. I think he should add pictures of the outside of the building. The shower got cold on my husband a few times but when I showered it was fine. Overall it was a great place to rest our heads for the night. We felt very safe with the security system.
Good place yo conduct a webinar from
Great communicative hosts! Thank you!

The hospitality was second to none! We felt soo welcomed by the host and the surroundings felt secure. We really enjoyed the openness of the host. Thanks to the host for being soo responsive to our needs!
Michael’s casita was awesome, everything you need to have a great and peaceful weekend, we will be staying here again
Great spot if you’re visiting Death Valley or Red Rocks!

We really appreciate Michael for letting us rent out his listing & I was able to bring my cats (it was really hard finding places who accept them!). He made us feel very comfortable with our first renting on here! Everything was really nice & peaceful! Would definitely recommend for a small getaway.

Felt right at home. We got in late the first night and I was wrapped in relief when I opened the door. It was so comforting. Everything was nice and clean. Pool was cool and clean. I didn’t want to go back home, to say the least 🩵
Beautiful little place. Perfect and cozy!!!

My husband and I stayed here on the first leg of our honeymoon. Michael’s cabin was the perfect spot between Vegas and Death Valley. We enjoyed the space, amenities, and views! Michael was super helpful and proactive. He gave us great food recommendations for the area. It was a perfect distance to Death Valley and the pool was a great way to cool off from the July temps!
Convenient location near Death Valley NP and great local restaurant recommendations!
It was a wonderful place to stay on our cross country travels. If you’re visiting Death Valley, it’s only 50 or so minutes away, and it is so nice! 10/10 recommend!

The tiny house was very comfortable and clean. The kitchen was well equipped so we could cook all our meals by ourselves.
The hosts were friendly and communicative and answered all of our questions immediately.
We would definetly stay again!
I’ve stayed on Michael’s property before & it’s always a good experience. Thank you Micheal!
Communication was top notch! Super responsive as we had some last second changes. Space was an easy hour drive to Death Valley. Comfortable space. Grill and pool were nice to cool off in hot heat.
Very cozy cottage with clean, well-equipped kitchen.

This place is so cute. The stay was comfortable, the only suggestion I would say is to stabilize the ladder better and have the BBQ cleaned and ready to go. we had to leave to BBQ at our friend's. Other than that I would recommend staying here again .
The place was easy to get to and cozy like the description stated.

We had a wonderful stay. It was very clean and comfortable. We were just too tired to use the hot tub or pool but both looked amazing. Easy drive from Death Valley. Close to town to replenish necessities and gas before heading back to the park. There were plenty of great restaurants close by.
My cousin and I booked this spot hours before we checked in and Michael was super accommodating!

We had a great stay at Mike’s guest house! The little home was very charming and had everything we needed. The decoration and photos were spot on. Mike was super responsive, which was another big plus.
Cute little house , cozy place to stay. Micheal is was a great host, very clear and gave us great recommendations !
Beautiful tiny house where we felt very comfortable.

we stayed here before going to death valley. it was a nice drive! we like the Thai restaurant My Thai that Michael recommended. Check it out if you like Thai food!
The stairs to the loft bed are not the most sturdy and it was hot in the loft. This was communicated in advance. No worries, we slept on the futon which pulls out to a full sized bed.
overall pleasant stay and good value.

My husband and I went for the annual Red Apple firework festival and stayed there for the weekend. The place was nice and spotless! Everything was clean and organized! Also very clear and easy instructions on how to check in! The place was super cute and comfortable! Would definitely stay there again!
An excellent, clean space that is perfect to getting into Death Valley, especially if you don’t want to pay more to stay in Beatty and you have dogs.

Michaels stay was perfect for our quick getaway to Death Valley! From the comfy loft bed to the private little fire pit, we felt we had everything we needed, plus a few special touches. If we had been able to stay longer, the kitchen would have really come in handy!
Lovely place!
Loved this cozy tiny house! It had a beautiful view of the desert mountains. Sitting in the hot tub and viewing the stars was a great experience.

My fiancé and I stayed at Michael’s place during our trip to Death Valley and had a great time! Michael was very responsive and friendly over messages and even offered several suggestions of things to do in the area. The house itself was very clean, tidy, and very cozy! The location was great too, within an hour of Death Valley and close to restaurants and grocery stores.
Such a great stay, definitely recommend.
Exactly as described. Very clean. Perfect location to explore Death Valley National Park.

We enjoyed our stay at Michael’s! There was a hiccup with the code for the alarm not working but they were on the property and came to help deactivate right away. The inside was clean and had all the essentials for a tiny house. Was a great home base for exploring Death Valley. The only thing we didn’t love was there were a lot of loud barking dogs on the surrounding properties so it felt a bit uncomfortable to sit outside and star gaze as we had hoped to do. The hot tub and pool are shared by Michael and his family and so we got to chat with them while we used the hot tub and they were friendly and welcoming. Would recommend this place for an affordable place while exploring the area.
Very cute tiny house with everything needed for a quick overnight in Pahrump.
This place was just what we needed after traveling all day!

Very nice little tiny home conveniently located between Las Vegas and Death Valley. The place was clean and cozy. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. Everything was perfect, I would stay here again!
Lovely loft in a quiet and peaceful area. Woke up to an amazing sun rise here.

We had a wonderful stay! This was a great base to explore Death Valley National Park. Highly recommend waking up early and driving to Zabriskie Point for sunrise. The space had everything we needed for a comfortable and cozy stay. It was an easy drive into town to get groceries at Smith's or to eat out. I appreciated the local recommendations Michael provided (Johnny's Tacos was delicious)! Check in was easy and flexible. Would stay again :)

My friend and I really enjoyed our stay in this charming space. It was super clean, spacious, comfortable, and very affordable! Michael was a great host and was super responsive. We will definitely be back when/if we come back to explore Death Valley NP again!
Loved this place for a quick trip to DVNP. Felt very homey and had an impressive amount of tech inside given it is a renovated shed. It was so cute and perfect and had an amazing bathroom too!
Good place to stay if you are going to the Death Valley NP.
Great!

Michael’s tiny home in Pahrump was great! It honestly feels bigger on the inside than it looks from the outside! It was the perfect distance between Las Vegas and Death Valley. The soace was spotless and had all the amenities you could need. We even chose to stay in and cook a full dinner on one of the nights, and everything they had was perfect! They gave us some great closeby recommendations and were extremely responsive. 5 stars!

This airbnb was just as described and extremely clean with super helpful and friendly hosts. An excellent choice for those adventuring to Death Valley or around Parhump! It's in a nice location in a quiet part of Parhump and easy to get anywhere with local amenities nearby. We would definitely stay here again.
super good cabin，and I really love the bed！
Michaels place was just as described and a needed spot that met all our needs to stay on budget! We would return again if our party stayed small ! Comfortable and clean and great value!
Exactly as the photos appear. Michael is very responsive. About an hour drive to Death Valley National Park.
It was very cute and cozy. We felt right at home. The location was close to Death Valley and Red Rocks. It also had beautiful views of the mountains.
We had a great weekend at Michael’s tiny home .. it was perfect for us , very clean and easy to stay.!

We needed a place to stay for a night while visiting Death Valley NP and Michael's place was perfect. It was not too far from the park, good location. The place was clean and had everything we needed to stay comfortably. We were able to squeeze in an hour of fire pit, super cozy! Highly recommend
Incredibly responsive host, clean place. I'm a female solo traveller and I felt extremely at home / safe here. So tiny and cute! I'll come back whenever I want to visit Death Valley.

A cabin nice and clean in the backyard of Michael's house. A good fit for two persons for a few days stay if your are going to spend some time for example in Death Valley National Park.
The cabin is well equipped with what you need for a short stay. Nice and comfortable bed situated on a loft. Kitchen table with two chairs was a little bit too tight to the ladder leading up to the loft.
However all in all a good choice considering the price and the comfort we got.
Michael’s was place was neat, clean, and cozy! I was amazed at how comfortable and spacious the tiny loft felt.
Great place to stay for hiking in Death Valley ~1 hour away. Cool loft which was very clean and easy to check in.
Good place to stay to visit Death Valley.
Lovely place to stay, not far from death valley. Very cute and cozy, enjoyed our stay

Immaculate and cozy space. The shower’s temperature control was nice, as well as it becoming hot in no time. With our stay in the winter, the heater was reliable at keeping us comfortable throughout our stay. My partner was also very comfortable from the accommodation(s) made by the host on the bedding, for his skin sensitivity. I highly recommend The Hubb if you want a friendly and humble local’s feel!
Quaint and cozy space that was great for one night after a Death Valley day trip

Wow! What a beautiful home and a great place to stay if you’re visiting Death Valley NP. It was extremely clean, cozy, and the wifi worked perfectly. Absolutely would stay again next time I visit the area.
*as a solo female traveler I felt very safe here*

perfect place- Michael was quick to respond and made it easy for us to check in and out. The place itself is lovely and clean, good internet connection and comes with a list of local recommendations- couldn’t ask for more!

Great place to stay if you’re looking to head to Death Valley National Park which is what we did. Everything in the photos and description is accurate. Ran into an issue with the heater remote not working and it was resolved right away. Fast communication and a lovely stay.
Cute spot to stay near Death Valley / Mt Charleston - fenced area for dogs and hot tub. Would recommend!
It’s a nice place and very convenient for food and gas station!
This was a great place. It was warm on cold nights and comfy for sleeping. The space is of course small, but it's well designed so I found it very functional. I would stay here again.

Awesome little private loft perfect for to use as home base to visit Death Valley National Park. Located right off the main road to the park, this spot is 40 minutes from the park and 10 minutes from all of the food and coffee Pahrump has to offer. Also has a gas station only a 2 minute drive away. Those hosts were extremely respensive and helpful, and the hot tub was great to soak in after a long day in the park hiking and exploring.

This place was great! As close as you can be to Death Valley without being in the park, and fantastic mountain/sunset views. Was clean, and the hosts had excellent communication: always responded to my questions quickly and were very helpful.

This place was so great as a hub for a Death Valley NP visit. It was quiet and quaint, sat by the fire every night. Michael and Gustavo were great and responsive hosts, had delicious food recommendations, and the neighbors are so kind as well. The tiny house had all the amenities I needed and was very clean and prepared for travelers. I’d stay here again in a heartbeat!
Beautiful place. You have everything you need to have a great night.
Great place to stay and very close to Death Valley National Park
This was a great place to stay for my birthday trip. Such a nice tiny home in a great location.
Very conveniently located to explore Death Valley. Airbnb was clean and comfortable. Michael was a great host and quick to respond.
Great value and very clean!
Perfect stay- thank you :-)
Perfect stay!
The place was cute and small, it felt very homey
The casita was perfect for what we needed! Clean, and exactly as it shows in the pictures. The house address was very hard to see in the dark, but otherwise check-in and communication was good.
A super handy air bnb for exploring nearby Death Valley. Clean, comfortable, and easy. Communication wss good and the restaurant recommendations were all hits.

This place was great, the room we booked had a Jacuzzi inside! And possibly the best bed/bed frame I’ve ever seen (think thick Victorian dark wood pillars).
The hosts were lovely, very accommodating. They explained everything for us when we arrived and made sure we knew where everything was and what we could use (there was a super well stocked kitchen).
Although you would be booking one room in a house in which they are hosting multiple Airbnb guests, it still works really well. The place has a hostel-ish vibe in the common area where you can chat to other guests. I had the good fortune of meeting a very interesting chap and we chatted deep into the evening.
The hosts even helped us with a reservation in another room of their house when we needed a last minute extra night in Pahrump.
10/10 I would definitely stay here again. I’m sure you’ll enjoy it too.
Really good placeto be!
great place a little cold but other than that great little getaway
Michael was a great host. Place was clean and the town is only 10 minutes away. Would recommend anyone to stay.
Great accommodations, quiet, clean, everything we needed.
Quiet stay.
The loft was clean, comfortable, and everything was as advertised. Check in was a breeze and Micheal was quick with communication. Would definitely stay again!
Nice tiny house. Well equipped. Nice little stay.

Our stay was great! The cozy cabin was fully equipped with all the comforts of home. Michael’s communication was excellent and he provided us with many local restaurant recommendations.
We highly recommend booking here :)
Thank you for a wonderful mini stay!

Michael’s place was perfect for an overnight during our quick stop in Pahrump. Check-in was seamless and Michael was very communicative. He shared things to do and places to eat which we took advantage of. This cute space has everything you need! Thank you Michael!

Michael’s place is a wonderful little Airbnb. Gustavo is one of the best hosts we’ve ever had. He looked after us really good, making our stay really easy and enjoyable.
If you are looking for a place to work, this has one really fast Wi-Fi!
Lovely get away, it has all the basic things you need in the kitchen, clean restroom, comfy bed, nice pool. Private and quiet. Thanks!
Everything great !
Great stay. Parking right at the front door. Comfortable futon. Great AC unit. Clean and quiet.
As advertised, everything was clean and working, bed was comfortable and we appreciated that it was pet friendly, we ended up having to bring our cat at the last minute.

This is a great stay if you’re looking to unplug. The stars shine bright and the loft is thoughtfully laid out and spacious. The hot tug was super relaxing as well. Michael is a great host with fast communication and I would recommend his place 100%!
Good communication, easy to find, clean, had everything we needed to cook.

Everything was spot on and as described in the ad. The shed is actually bigger than it looks and it's quiet and clean. I checked in kind of late at night self check in was a breeze. I would stay here again no problem. The view isn't too shabby either.
This place is perfect. It was very clean and the amenities were in excellent condition. Simply furnished yet very comfortable. It's on a quiet street and you can see the milky way. Perfect!

very much recommend Michael's place to stay! we stayed here overnight before heading to death valley. it was an easy 50 minute drive to DVNP. the place is smaller but has everything you could need for an overnight or couple day stay while you visit death valley!
Clean and cozy mini house. It looks better in reality than on photos. Everything you need is there. Comfortable bed, cold water waiting for you in the fridge, coffee cups, great AC. Very nice place!

Our stay here was great! It is a tiny home but suited two adults and a dog perfectly! And the views were amazing at sunset! Michael was an amazing host as well! Gave us a list of restaurants in the area and had great communication with any questions we had.

We had a lovely stay! Everything was perfect, very clean house, nice kitchen and great terrace!
The room was perfect!
We will come back without hesitation!
We most definitely enjoyed our stay. (: very nice .😊

We enjoyed our stay and Michael was very helpful and provided great recommendations for local spots to visit. This was a cozy little getaway that was very accessible if you plant to visit Death Valley National Park.

If I am ever back in the area, I will 100% stay again! Michael was so easy to communicate with, so helpful in providing recommendations and the location was easy to find, clean and cozy! If you’re planning on visiting Death Valley National Park, this is a MUST stay!
Perfect little place for a quick nights rest on a road trip.
Very clean and comfortable space!
Probably my favorite Airbnb I’ve stayed at so far. Amazing scenery , Amazing atmosphere, Amazing experience.
The place was great. It was very clean, comfy and the kitchen had everything we needed. It was really a nice place to stay during our journey.
Perfect stay, easy Check in, friedly neighborhood, groomed and clean!
We stayed at the tiny house for one night, check-in was super easy and the details matched.
Super lovely place to live in! The place is clean and neat. A lot better than what we expected.

Michael’s AirBNB was in fact a unique loft.
Exterior-wise, the loft is surrounded by beautiful mountains & hills creating a beautiful scenery. Additionally, it offers peace and quiet due to its location in relation to Parhump.
Interior-wise, the loft is clean. Its utilities (water, lighting, & AC) all functioned exceptionally and were well appreciated by us especially after a long day of hiking and exploring.
Last but not least, Michael is a great host! He gives great recommendations for nearby restaurants and cafe that were great. Michael responds quickly and provides clear instructions that allowed our trip to go as smoothly as possible. We had even met some neighbors on our way to exploring and they were extremely friendly as well.
Overall this was a great experience that we enjoyed! If you are looking for an affordable place for some peace & convenience when planning to visit Vegas, Death Valley, etc. we highly recommended Michael’s AirBNB!
We had a great stay. The place had everything we needed to be comfortable and happy while visiting

Loved staying at this tiny home. Super clean and really spacious for a tiny house. Kitchen and bathroom are really big for a tiny house too. Great hosts too. They even had a pool! Will stay there again next time we are in Pahrump.
The Loft is really cozy! We enjoyed our stay. The view was great and the location was perfect for us. The communication with Michael was really good and we felt very welcome :)
We really enjoyed staying in this cute and tidy little place. We had everything we needed and the communication with the host was very easy. We strongly recommend it!
Michael's air bnb was amazing! such a great little place to stay if you are going to death valley or Vegas! I would highly recommend it to anyone!

This is the perfect Airbnb & the perfect location if you are just wanting to get away. It’s less than 1 hour from Las Vegas, and less than one hour from Death Valley National Park. I highly recommend booking this Airbnb for almost any occasion.
Very clean and nice space with updated appliances. The area is set up in a way that it does not feel crowded and there is plenty of space to relax.
awesome .... just awsome
A very cozy and beautiful house. Pool to cool off, the host helps you in everything you need.
Great little place visited death valley and stayed here for one night! Wish we could have used the pool but we didnt have time! Super clean and cozy!

This is a cute tiny home with a loft that is not for the person's with a fear of heights or doesn't have a sense of adventure. All the basics were covered and a nice shower. Plus if you like Thai food make sure to eat at My Thai, Max the owner is a hoot! The food is fabulous!
Only giving this place two thumbs up because I only have two thumbs up to give! Amazing spot and absolutely beautiful to star watch at night! This place is a steal!

Michael is a great host who responds extremely quickly. We really liked the accommodation in Pahrump. It was quiet very private and we could even go into the pool. The kitchen was very well appointed and the bed was comfortable. However, we have a small criticism: we found a lot of animal hair on the floor (partly whole bushes), on the bath rugs and on a blanket that we had taken out of the closet when we were cold on the sofa. For someone with animal hair allergies, it might be difficult. But since we don't have an allergy, it was still okay. We would come back any time because we felt very comfortable and the place was very comfortable.
Very clean and easy to access. All amenities function perfectly and very scenic views if you like mountains, sunrises and sunsets.
I enjoyed my stay at Michael’s place. It’s conveniently located right outside of Death Valley. Everything is in great conditions, and as described. I would stay here again.
they ate awsoem helpful people.

Super cute spot! Perfect for a solo traveler to crash or spend the day working. I enjoyed having somewhere close to stat after checking out all the local wineries and distillery! I would come here again!
Stayed here after a day in Death Valley NP. Perfect stay for a couple. Pet friendly. Great shower. A/C worked great. Clean. Great communication.
Very clean and nicely furnished. The bed is a little short for someone of average height and stairs are quite steep so not recommended for who is scared of heights!
An amazing gem of an air bnb, massive on the inside and very responsive. 10/10 would stay again.

Great little base before heading to Death Valley. We didn’t know how to use the oven and were assisted super quickly!
Cute space with good amenities, nice and clean with great host. Lovely to have a swim in the pool in the heat too!
The tiny house was clean and spacious, and the perfect quiet spot to do laptop work and rest at the end of my seasonal job. Wifi is fast and Michael is responsive!

This space was just as advertised! It was clean, had all the basic necessities, and Michael was a very kind host (with food local restaurant recommendations as well!)! It's about an hour and a half from Death Valley National Park and an hour from Las Vegas. A perfect launching point for whatever adventure you are looking for. Would definitely stay here again!

Perfect little place for what we needed! My fiancé and I plus our pupparoo were on our way back to SLC from a trip down the California coastline and needed a place to stop for the night outside of Las Vegas. We intended to visit Death Valley because of the proximity but ended up skipping it. Rachel’s place… good if you want to see Death Valley, but that’s all there is to it. Not good if you want to get some rest. To explain: Because Death Valley is so dry (extremely), static energy builds up so much you will get shocked by anything, even the person you’re sleeping next to. This is not Rachel’s fault, but she could have solved it very easily. She had “salt lamps”, which are helpful but the static being so extreme because of dryness, a humidifier would have been perfect. (We ended up buying one ourselves because it was unbearable).
What bothered us most was the heat. We came during the cold season, the beginning of November. The only heating we had was a wall heater in the room which had no adaptations whatsoever. So when it got got it got extremely hot and when it would stop it would get extremely cold. Everywhere else in the house/apartment/place it was absolutely freezing. When you exited the 73 degree room you would go into the hall/bathroom/living room you would experience 56 degrees. The problem was that I knew the house had central heating, so I asked Rachel to turn it up. She had written in the description and the private welcome message that if we want her to adjust the temperature of the house we should message her. So that’s what we did. She told me all she could do was bring me another blanket or wall heater. Very upsetting.
There is no means of heating of cooling anything. This place is really missing a microwave/fridge (I guess another way of trying to save money). One of the two is truly needed.
Other small things bothered us: no hairdryer anywhere, no blackout blinds (sun rises on that side in your eyes) and a very hard to operate shower head+tube.
I know it could improve so much and is probably better when the weather is hotter. But we did not have a good time getting zapped and being cold.
